title: About Morri
text:
Hi — I’m Morri, a data scientist with a clinical background, an MPH in progress, and a serious love of health data. I work at the intersection of epidemiology, bioinformatics, and analytics, building tools that make large, messy datasets more useful for research and public health. I’m especially excited by omics, reproducibility, and clever ways to reduce human effort without sacrificing rigor.
Before pivoting to data science, I spent over a decade as a nurse and educator — so I know my way around both a CRRT machine and a good data pipeline. My projects range from fuzzy-matching patient records across data sets, to meta-analyzing EWAS studies, to modeling viral phylogenies for vaccine strain selection.
I care deeply about clarity, collaboration, and doing science that’s useful. I’d love to work on research teams, data-heavy health projects, or anything that needs solid analysis and a thoughtful partner. (Also: the dog’s name is Lucy. She does not code.)




MPH in Epidemiology, In Progress (Est. December 2025)
University of Texas Health Sciences Center, School of Public Health (Houston, TX, USA)
Certificate: Genomics & Bioinformatics
Certificate: Data Science
Thesis: Epigenome-Wide Associations of Factor VIII and Von Willebrand Factor Levels (In Progress, Meta-Analysis, de Vries Lab)
BSc in Nursing, 2019
University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX, USA)
BSc in Biology, 2013
University of Texas at Dallas (Richardson, TX, USA)  Minor: Sociology






UTHealth Sciences Center, School of Public Health (Houston, TX, USA)

PI: Dr. M. Brad Cannell
Contributed to public health research projects (DETECT, DETECT-RPC, Link2Care), supporting the full data lifecycle — from collection and cleaning to analysis and reporting.
Developed and implemented probabilistic fuzzy-matching techniques using the fastLink R package to link subject data across datasets lacking common identifiers.
Drafted statistical analysis plans, IRB protocols, informed consent forms, and conducted statistical analyses in R.




Travel Nurse Across America, USA

Rapidly deployed to hospitals nationwide, delivering expert-level critical care in ICU and ED settings, managing complex cases across multiple specialties.
Led interdisciplinary teams, acted as Charge Nurse and educator, and routinely utilized advanced technologies (e.g. ECMO, IABP, CRRT, Impella, and Blakemore/Compass, etc.)




Rochester General Hospital, Rochester, NY, USA



City of Plano, Plano, TX, USA
